kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
I'll use the [Kentico Community Portal](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal) as an example of where all the configuration values need set in a project to make client/React administration customization work.
1. In the [.csproj](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v29.4.1.3/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Admin/Kentico.Community.Portal.Admin.csproj) of the project containing the React code ```xml <PropertyGroup> <AdminOrgName>kentico-community</AdminOrgName> </PropertyGroup>
<!-- ... --> <ItemGroup> <AdminClientPath Include="Client\dist\**"> <ProjectName>portal-web-admin</ProjectName> </AdminClientPath> </ItemGroup> ``` 1. In the [webpack.config.js](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v29.4.1.3/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Admin/Client/webpack.config.js) of the client app ```js return baseWebpackConfig({ orgName: 'kentico-community', projectName: 'portal-web-admin', webpackConfigEnv, argv, }); ``` 1. In the [AdminModule](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v29.4.1.3/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Admin/PortalWebAdminModule.cs#L36) declared in your Admin project containing the client app ```cs protected override void OnInit(ModuleInitParameters parameters) { base.OnInit(parameters);
RegisterClientModule( "kentico-community", "portal-web-admin"); } ``` 1. Additionally, make sure all your React/TypeScript types are exported [from your `index.tsx`](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/main/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Admin/Client/src/entry.tsx) 1. Your [references to client components](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v29.4.1.3/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Admin/Features/QAndA/QAndAListingPage.cs#L81) need to be [correctly formed](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v29.4.1.3/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Admin/Components/URLValidationRule.cs#L19) in [your C# classes](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v29.4.1.3/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Admin/Features/Members/MemberManagementPage.cs#L14). ```csharp .AddComponentColumn( nameof(WebPageItemInfo.WebPageItemName), "@kentico-community/portal-web-admin/Link", modelRetriever: AnswerLinkModelRetriever, caption: "Question", searchable: true, minWidth: 25); ``` 1. Your [CMSAdminClientModuleSettings](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v29.4.1.3/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Web/appsettings.Development.json#L95) needs to be correctly set in your ASP.NET Core `appsettings.json` ```json "CMSAdminClientModuleSettings": { "kentico-community-portal-web-admin": { "Mode": "Proxy", "Port": 3019, "UseSSL": true } } ``` 1. You also need to ensure the webpack dev server is serving over https if your ASP.NET Core app is running over https and the webpack dev server [needs to be using a trusted localhost cert](https://github.com/Kentico/community-portal/blob/v29.4.1.3/src/Kentico.Community.Portal.Admin/Client/webpack.config.js#L81).
